alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 20 at 2:10AM PST until January 23 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST SUNDAY MONO COUNTY ABOVE 7500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT FOR MONO COUNTY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory in Mono County above 7500 feet, snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, locally 6 to 12 inches along the Sierra crest. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph, with gusts to 65 mph along the Sierra crest. For the Winter Storm Watch for Mono County above 7000 feet, heavy snow. Snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches along and west of US-395 with 12 to 18 inches near the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the daily commutes through Monday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
